MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001332
Special Investigation Intake Date: April 11, 2024
License #: CB520304693
Licensee Group Organization: Upper Peninsula Family Solutions
Licensee Designee: SANDRA SHELTROW
Chief Administrator: Tracey LYNN Compton
Agency Name: UPPER PENINSULA FAMILY SOLUTIONS
Agency Address: 369 US HIGHWAY 41 E
NEGAUNEE, MI 49866-9624
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 05/18/2026
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Contact Purpose
Method
4/15/2024 11:32 AM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
6/11/2024 9:52 AM Phone Interview
6/11/2024 9:57 AM Email Documentation received or sent
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Visitation and family time; in person contact
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421
Section • (1) An agency shall develop a plan of visitation and family
Description time for each child in foster care consistent with the child's
service plans, as required by R 400.12419 and R
400.12420 to ensure the safety and well-being of the child.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Mother not provided visits.
Investigation Allegation was made that the agency has discontinued services
with the mother of Youth A and stopped visits two months ago.
Interviews:
I interviewed Chief Administrator by telephone on 4/15/2024.
Chief Administrator reported parenting visits for Mother of Youth A
were suspended by the court of jurisdiction until Mother of Youth A
had completed 3 weeks of clean drug screens. A copy of the
court order was received 4/17/2024.
I interviewed Chief Administrator and Foster Care Worker by
phone on 6/11/2024. Chief Administrator and Foster Care Worker
both reported parenting time had been implemented for Mother of
Youth A following a court hearing on 4/16/2024 that authorized
Mother of Youth A to have parenting time with Youth A. They also
described positive progress in the case with parenting time and
potential reunification.
I attempted to contact Mother of Youth A and left messages on
6/11/2024 and 6/17/2024 to confirm her parenting time, but no
return calls were received.
Documents Reviewed:
A copy of the court order dated 2/14/2024 indicated parenting time
by Mother of Youth A, even if supervised may be harmful.
The court order dated 4/16/2024 authorized the implementation of
parenting time for Mother of Youth A with Youth A.
Parenting time is scheduled for 1 hour 2 times a week. Social
work contacts documented parenting time for Mother of Youth A,
following the court’s approval occurred April 18, 23,25,29,30, May
8,9,14,16,20,23,28 and June 2,4, and 10.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as parenting time for Mother of
Youth A was initiated upon the approval/authorization of the court
of jurisdiction.
Technical Assistance:
2

Technical assistance was offered that parenting time visitation
plan in MISACWIS be updated to reflect what the current plan of
visitation is as it was not updated since February 2024.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
6/17/2024
